security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation with no executable code. It provides instructions for using AI assistants to generate changelogs from git commits. No security risks detected.

content.user_title: Generate User-Friendly Changelogs from Git History
content.value_statement: Stop spending hours translating technical git commits into customer-friendly release notes. This skill automatically analyzes your commit history and creates polished changelogs that users actually understand.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes git commits from specified time periods or versions
Categorizes changes into features, improvements, bug fixes, and breaking changes
Translates technical commit messages into customer-friendly language
Filters out internal commits like refactoring and tests
limitations: Requires access to git repository with commit history
Cannot generate content without existing commits to analyze
May need manual review for accuracy and completeness
Limited to analyzing commits in the current repository

use_cases.title: Weekly Product Updates
use_cases.description: Generate customer-facing updates for weekly product newsletters and in-app notifications from recent development activity.

use_cases.title: Release Documentation
use_cases.description: Create comprehensive release notes for version deployments, app store submissions, and stakeholder communications.

use_cases.title: Community Changelogs
use_cases.description: Maintain clear, user-friendly changelogs for open source projects to help contributors and users understand changes.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Changelog
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a changelog for all commits from the past week, organizing them into features, improvements, and bug fixes

prompt_templates.title: Version Release
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate release notes for new version
prompt_templates.prompt: Create release notes for version 2.5.0 based on commits since v2.4.0, focusing on user-facing changes

prompt_templates.title: Custom Style
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a changelog using the style guidelines from CHANGELOG_STYLE.md for commits since last release

prompt_templates.title: Date Range
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a changelog for commits between March 1-15, highlighting major features and breaking changes

output_examples.input: Create a changelog for commits from the past 7 days
output: - **Team Workspaces**: Create separate workspaces for different projects. Invite team members and keep everything organized.
- **Keyboard Shortcuts**: Press ? to see all available shortcuts. Navigate faster without touching your mouse.
- **Faster Sync**: Files now sync 2x faster across devices
- **Better Search**: Search now includes file contents, not just titles
- Fixed issue where large images wouldn't upload
- Resolved timezone confusion in scheduled posts

best_practices: Run from your git repository root to ensure access to complete commit history
Specify clear date ranges or version boundaries for focused, relevant changelogs
Review and customize generated content before publishing to ensure accuracy
anti_patterns: Don't rely solely on automated output - always review for context and accuracy
Avoid generating changelogs without specifying time ranges - this creates overly long outputs
Don't skip filtering - remove internal commits that don't affect users

faq.question: Which git repositories are compatible?
faq.answer: Works with any git repository containing commit history. Run from the repository root for best results.

faq.question: How far back can I generate changelogs?
faq.answer: Can analyze any time period with available commits - from days to years depending on your repository history.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, use the prompts in automation scripts to generate changelogs during releases or on schedule.

faq.question: Is my commit data safe?
faq.answer: The skill only reads local git history and doesn't transmit data externally. All processing happens locally.

faq.question: The output seems incomplete. What's wrong?
faq.answer: Ensure you're in the correct repository directory and specify clear date ranges or version boundaries.

faq.question: How does this compare to conventional changelog tools?
faq.answer: Unlike rigid formatters, this skill intelligently categorizes and translates technical commits into customer language.
